Articles.Content:
I landed a plane on Laythe, but when I attached it to the rocket in pairs it must have rotated the control point.

Is there a way I could rotate it manually, with the debug menu, or with MechJeb?

The plane is able to fly at a 90 degree angle but doesnt operate very well at all.

Edited January 20, 2015 by whiterafter

I don't think you can arbitrarily change it - however, you may consider clicking on the various probe/crew/docking-port parts and trying to 'control from here' for a usable orientation.Surely one of the docking ports will be correct?
I don't have docking ports this is just a plane I dropped on Laythe that worked somewhat well on Kerbin.

I don't have docking ports this is just a plane I dropped on Laythe that worked somewhat well on Kerbin.

Right click on the cockpit and choose "control from here". You must have at least two control parts. The only way attaching it to the rocket would do that is if the cockpit of the plane were on wrong. The navball adjusts to the part orientation of the part you are controlling from.
